verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments, set to the Sheminith. A Psalm of David. O Jehovah<WH3068>, rebuke<WH3198> me not in thine anger<WH639>, Neither chasten<WH3256> me in thy hot displeasure<WH2534>.
Have mercy<WH2603> upon me<WH3068>, O Jehovah; for I am withered<WH536> away<WH3068>: O Jehovah, heal<WH7495> me<WH6106>; for my bones are troubled<WH926>.
My soul<WH5315> also is sore<WH3966> troubled<WH926>: And thou<WH3068>, O Jehovah, how long?
Return <WH7725>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, deliver<WH2502> my soul<WH5315>: Save<WH3467> me for thy lovingkindness<WH2617>' sake.
For in death<WH4194> there is no remembrance<WH2143> of thee<WH7585>: In Sheol who shall give thee thanks<WH3034>?
I am weary<WH3021> with my groaning<WH585>; Every night<WH3915> make I my bed<WH4296> to swim<WH7811>; I water<WH4529> my couch<WH4296> with my tears<WH1832>.
Mine eye<WH5869> wasteth<WH6244> away because of grief<WH3708>; It waxeth old<WH6275> because of all mine adversaries<WH6887>.
Depart <WH5493> from me<WH6466>, all ye workers of iniquity<WH205>; For Jehovah<WH3068> hath heard<WH8085> the voice<WH6963> of my weeping<WH1065>.
Jehovah <WH3068> hath heard<WH8085> my supplication<WH8467>; Jehovah<WH3068> will receive<WH3947> my prayer<WH8605>.
All mine enemies<WH341> shall be put to shame<WH954> and sore<WH3966> troubled<WH926>: They shall turn back<WH7725>, they shall be put to shame<WH954> suddenly<WH7281>.
